PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8164 - Benchmarking VAIO-Integrated Caching. Is it Really Faster? How Much, and Why?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: You may have already heard about the vSphere APIs for IO Filtering (VAIO) in vSphere 6, and how they allow you to use third party caching data services to achieve lower latency storage IO. But just how much lower latency does the new API framework enable versus previous cache designs? As the developer of a PVSP-certified solid-state cache integrated with vSphere 5 through the Pluggable Storage Architecture (PSA), as well as VMware design partner for the caching APIs in the VAIO framework, we’ve investigated this issue thoroughly. Using a variety of workloads and IO profiles, we’ve benchmarked the responsiveness of cache performance in both designs to measure how much a solid-state host cache can reduce IO latency through VAIO versus the PSA and VMFS stack. In this session, you can see the data from a variety of our comparison tests. In addition, you can learn about other new design features and capabilities in VAIO, such as virtual disk-level acceleration, that deliver additional performance benefits for specific types of workloads. Demonstrations of the test methodologies and results will be provided.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7973 - Architecting Site Recovery Manager to Meet Your Recovery Goals
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware customers have a variety of options available when deciding how to architect their Site Recovery Manager deployment. The optimal way to configure SRM depends on whether customers are prioritizing speed of recovery or want fine-grained control of their disaster recovery plans. This session will cover organization of protection groups and recovery plans, supported SRM topologies, and specific suggestions for improving VM recovery time performance. If you are interested in making the most of your SRM deployment to meet your businesses DR needs and want to know how to get the most from the latest SRM capabilities this is the session for you.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8422 - Virtual Volumes: Why?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Ever wonder why you need VVols? VVol transforms the way VMs are stored and enables VM awareness on the array, eliminating static storage constraints and giving the array direct visibility and understanding of the VM objects. VVols can enable a flexible policy based approach to storing and managing VMs. We will look at VVol framework and how EMC is using this to deliver a new generation of VM-aware storage that puts the VMs in charge. You will learn about this revolutionary change in the way storage is delivered to VMware environments, and why this industry-wide initiative will provide you with a new, efficient and intelligent ways to use storage arrays.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7848 - Virtual SAN Storage Efficiency Technologies
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Virtual SAN is the leading hyperconverged infrastructure storage solution for VMware virtualized environments. Virtual SAN all-flash configurations provide extreme performance andsupport storage efficiency technologies such as thin provisioning, deduplication and compression, and erasure coding. These features effectively lower the cost per usable GB of flash storage tolevels on par with or lower than similar hybrid storage solutions. This session will provide technical details on how these Virtual SAN storage efficiency features work. We will examine a fewreal-world examples of Virtual SAN space efficiency technologies in customer environments. The session will also provide design guidelines and recommendations for using these features. Wewill conclude with plenty of time for questions and answers with Virtual SAN product management.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7549 - Achieving Agility, Flexibility , Scalability and Performance with VMware Software Defined Storage (SDS) and Virtual Volumes for Business critical databases
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Virtual Volumes has gained increasing adoption from Storage vendors since its release. Virtual Volumes can help provide many distinct capabilities for virtualized Tier 1 Databases that were not available with traditional storage. Running business critical databases on SDDC requires the use of policy-based storage leveraging Virtual Volumes capabilities, which this session will showcase.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8246R - Virtual SAN Technical Deep Dive and What’s New
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session we will provide a technical deep dive on Virtual SAN and also cover the new feature enhancements in the product. VMware Virtual SAN is radically simple, hyper-converged infrastructure designed and optimized for vSphere virtual infrastructure. We will deep dive into installing, managing, and monitoring Virtual SAN and provide details on value proposition, use cases and new features as well as design and sizing guidance and best practices.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8619 - Transitioning to VVols: Partner Panel
PresentationDetailsList.Description: As Virtual Volumes celebrates its first year we are seeing the types of customer conversations we have shifting from “Why” to “How”. The “Why” is simple: Virtual Volumes make storage simpler, faster and smarter using policy-driven automation and improves resource utilization by enabling more flexible consumption of storage resources when needed and with greater granularity.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9925 - Enterprise-grade data protection for Virtual SAN with EMC Recoverpoint for VMs
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Have you wondered what is the best solution for protecting applications and their data running on VMware Virtual SAN solution ? In this session, we will review why thousands of customers are choosing Virtual SAN as their primary storage solution. We will then review the various choices available to you including VMware vSphere Replication and EMC RecoverPoint for VMs. We will show you how to add enterprise grade data protection to your Virtual SAN environments by discussing use-cases such as local and remote protection, sync or async replication with near zero RPO, any point in time recovery, consistency groups, multi-site protection, and DR orchestration

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7903 - An Industry Roadmap: From storage to data management
PresentationDetailsList.Description: A look into the future of storage and data management for the Software-Defined Data Center. This sessions covers multiple use cases around data protection and storage analytics and the long-term strategy vision.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9014 - Deploying HCI at datacenter scale
PresentationDetailsList.Description: HCI is emerging as a preferred architecture for compute and storage in the SDDC. As HCI deployment grow in scale networking becomes a critical factor. In this session we will discuss best practices and new solution to deploy HCI at datacenter scale

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9157R - Achieving Unprecedented Availability, Security, & Cost Savings with VMware Virtual SAN and NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Using vSphere vMotion and HA within a cluster is old news...but would you like to hear how you can get that same level of simplicity for moving VMs across data centers, or automatically restarting VMs at another data center should you lose part or all of one data center? Baystate Health, a leading Healthcare organization, has leveraged VMware's Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC) to meet ever increasing demands for high availability and security while facing IT budget cuts. We'll review Baystate Health's design, key configurations, and lessons they learned from running production workloads on vSphere 6, Virtual SAN (VSAN), and NSX across three data centers in this active-active-active design. This design enables zero-downtime application mobility across data centers, as well as automated HA failover in the event a host or an entire site is lost. VMware NSX provides key capabilities for ensuring IP mobility across the three data centers and builds security into the virtual infrastructure with distributed firewall and micro-segmentation capabilities.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8880 - Successful ROBO Design with vSphere & Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Virtual SAN is radically simple storage for vSphere that is taking the IT world by storm. While it can scale up very easily, it is also a very good fit for Remote Office Branch Office use cases because it provides high performance and ease of management at a great cost. If you’d like to get to know more about how to design a distributed Virtual SAN configuration for a multiple site configuration, this is the session. This session will cover topics such as host sizing, network topology, and licensing from start to finish.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8562 - Deployable and Tactical Hyper-Converged Software (HCS) for the Battlefield
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Military, government, emergency services/first responders, and civilian/commercial customer based organizations are dynamically changing as mission requirements are leading technology leaders to embrace strategic computing innovations with VMware Hyper-Converged Software (HCS). Working with industry & government partners, VMware & DTECH LABS created an integrated, deployable, and tactical communications solution using VMware Virtual SAN. It's a portable distributed system which provides software-defined storage capability for space-constrained environments such as military/commercial vehicles, ships, aircrafts, tactical vehicles, tents, command centers, joint special operations, surveillance, and many other requirements that require a small form factor. The M3-SE-VSVR-P is a high powered 5th generation Core i7 computer with 32 GB of RAM designed to support multiple virtual machines in a small rugged form factor. The M3-SE-VSVR-P includes 10 hard drive slots intended to be used with VMware Virtual SAN. It provides a low risk solution that can operate in austere environments to independently support the customer's no-fail mission needs. From war fighters on the battlefield that need rugged, reliable, and scalable solutions to law enforcement keeping our streets safe, the ability to have reliable solutions that collect data is mission critical and must withstand challenging working conditions. VMware Virtual SAN & DTECH LABS have the best in class solutions to meet your mission requirement anywhere... anytime.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8795 - Ushering in a New Era of Hyperconverged Big Data - Hadoop over VSAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Unleash the simplicity and power of big data in a Hyperconverged environment by running Hadoop on your all-flash VSAN cluster! Intel and VMware present the results of running Hadoop workloads on a standard all-flash VSAN cluster. In the past, virtualized Hadoop workloads have been demonstrated on ESX clusters with Big Data Extensions (BDE). We take virtualized Hadoop to the next level by running it on VMware VSAN clusters. Running Hadoop over VSAN immediately provides Hadoop with all the advantages VSAN 6.2 brings to the table like Replication, Fault Tolerance, Compression, Erasure Code, Data De-Duplication, all while being highly integrated into the ESXi Hypervisor. All-Flash VSAN provides robust performance for Hadoop workloads, and reduces the TCO for customers by virtualizing many hundreds of Hadoop servers running as VMs on a much lower number of physical servers. VMware and Intel embarked on a joint project to showcase Hadoop workloads on VSAN based on high customer demand for running big data analytics on VSAN nodes. We will be presenting the benefits and results of running Hadoop on VSAN including CapEx, and OpEx benefits, and performance results of running the TPC-x-HS benchmarks. We will be sharing performance comparisons of running Bare-metal Hadoop vs Virtualized Hadoop with BDE vs Hyperconverged Hadoop over VSAN. The testing, and benchmarking will be done on an 8 node followed by 32 node VSAN cluster highlighting the capabilities of linear storage scale out architecture and performance. All VSAN nodes are powered by Intel Xeon Processor Based Servers, Intel NVMe SSDs, Intel SATA SSDs, and Intel Network Adapters along with VMware VSAN 6.2.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8750 - Troubleshooting Virtual SAN 6.2: Tips & Tricks for the Real World
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Virtual SAN 6.2 is the fourth generation of VMware's radically simple, enterprise-class software-defined storage that powers leading Hyper-Converged Infrastructure solutions. Virtual SAN 6.2 includes significant new capabilities including Deduplication and Compression, RAID 5/6 support, and IOPS limits. We will explore these new features and focus on helping you understand how to take advantage and utilize them in real-world settings.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8718-SPO - Building Next-Gen Data Protection for VMware Environments with Rubrik
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Imagine a data protection solution that uses a scale-out, shared-nothing architecture that was driven by simple and powerful policies instead of mundane and frustrating backup jobs. One that is smart enough to analyze your VMware clusters and workloads, automatically provide protection without having to be told what to do, and leverages a global search engine to find and restore data no matter where it lives. If that sounds light years better than your current data protection architecture, this is the session for you. Join technical experts from Rubrik, the pioneer in Converged Data Management, for a workshop on simplifying management and achieving granular RPOs and near-zero RTOs with an architecture that is powered by SLAs, enabled by global search, and built upon an infinitely scalable fabric.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9423 - File Services on Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Are you considering using your Virtual SAN to deliver file services for your organization? A number of partner developed file services solutions that pair well with Virtual SAN have recently become available. This session will focus on virtual storage array (VSA) based solutions that address file services with both NFS and SMB protocols. The session will cover why Virtual SAN is ideal for file services and provide details of several partner solutions as well as discuss the design tradeoffs when selecting a particular solution.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8246R - Virtual SAN Technical Deep Dive and What’s New
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session we will provide a technical deep dive on Virtual SAN and also cover the new feature enhancements in the product. VMware Virtual SAN is radically simple, hyper-converged infrastructure designed and optimized for vSphere virtual infrastructure. We will deep dive into installing, managing, and monitoring Virtual SAN and provide details on value proposition, use cases and new features as well as design and sizing guidance and best practices.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9981-SPO - The Irrational Data Growth Problem at Scale: How do I make the leap from data to information and gain insight?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Many organizations have started their journey towards the Software Defined Data Center (SDDC). While making this journey, they have run into problems finding, protecting, saving, identifying and using valuable information. Come hear the Veritas approach to solving your irrational data growth problem. Attend this session to learn best practices, performance optimization, and tuning approaches to finding and protecting data. Hear how Veritas integrates with VMware technology to solve the irrational data growth problem at scale.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8699 - Building a Business Case for VMware Hyper-Converged Software with Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: You are already familiar with VMware Virtual SAN, but you are not sure whether it is the right solution for your environment or whether you can justify its purchase especially an all flash configuration. In this session we will help you unwind this problem and provide practical tools you can use to build a business case for Virtual SAN, the software-defined storage in VMware Hyper-Converged Software. We will cover our Virtual SAN Assessment process, including the Virtual Infrastructure Planner (VIP) tool, and how to use the VIP tool results from your environment with our online Sizing and TCO calculator. Putting it all together you’ll get a very comprehensive understanding of if and where Virtual SAN fits into your datacenter to power Hyper-Converged Infrastructure solutions.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8204 - Cohesity & VMware: Simplifying data protection for Vsphere and Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: How do you achieve the agility, performance and resiliency needed for your business critical applications ? Hear how Tribune Media, a major US corporation achieved this goal by choosing two complementary hyper-converged solutions - Virtual SAN for primary storage needs and Cohesity for secondary storage needs. Virtual SAN provides a cost-effective and simple to use storage solution with predictable and consistent performance. Cohesity addresses all your secondary storage needs such as local and remote data protection, data analytics and Test/Dev into a simple, web-scale solution. In this session, we will briefly review the benefits of Virtual SAN for primary storage, and Cohesity for a comprehensive secondary storage solution. Then, you will hear directly from Tribune Media on how they achieved the vision led by CIO David Giambruno for a nimble, cost-effective, robust private cloud infrastructure to support their business needs.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7645r - Virtual Volumes Technical Deep Dive
STO9157R - Achieving Unprecedented Availability, Security, & Cost Savings with VMware Virtual SAN and NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Using vSphere vMotion and HA within a cluster is old news...but would you like to hear how you can get that same level of simplicity for moving VMs across data centers, or automatically restarting VMs at another data center should you lose part or all of one data center? Baystate Health, a leading Healthcare organization, has leveraged VMware's Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC) to meet ever increasing demands for high availability and security while facing IT budget cuts. We'll review Baystate Health's design, key configurations, and lessons they learned from running production workloads on vSphere 6, Virtual SAN (VSAN), and NSX across three data centers in this active-active-active design. This design enables zero-downtime application mobility across data centers, as well as automated HA failover in the event a host or an entire site is lost. VMware NSX provides key capabilities for ensuring IP mobility across the three data centers and builds security into the virtual infrastructure with distributed firewall and micro-segmentation capabilities.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7791-SPO - Insights to success: Capitalizing on the software-defined data center with the right management and storage
PresentationDetailsList.Description: What role does software-defined storage (SDS) have in the software-defined data center (SDDC)? What advantages does SDS have over traditional storage? Join a panel of early adopter experts who will share their experiences and tips for successfully building a solid storage foundation for their hybrid cloud and SDDC using the latest offerings from VMware and IBM. Trailblazing companies such as Time Warner Cable and Cobalt Iron will reveal key success factors for achieving business and information technology (IT) outcomes. They will discuss how organizations can build hybrid clouds by extending and migrating on-premises VMware-based workloads to the IBM Cloud. Key to building a robust SDDC, the ability to deploy applications in this hybrid cloud environment in a simple, agile, and secure manner will also be presented. Automating storage management and data protection are by no means simple tasks. Panelists will disclose how they have accomplished automation and other cloud goals using the VMware vRealize Suite and VMware vCloud Director. They will also discuss how they have overcome challenges to achieve the requisite levels of performance, scalability, and security for all forms of data. You’ll learn how virtualization and automation can help you transform from a traditional shop to an IT-as-a-Service model, thereby achieving the ultimate business goals of becoming more agile and competitive. And, finally, you’ll have an opportunity to ask panelists how they have combined VMware technologies - such as VASA, VMware Virtual Volumes, Site Recovery Manager - and IBM Spectrum Storage to build future-proof hybrid clouds and data centers.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8344 - SRM with vRA 7: Automating Disaster Recovery Operations
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Site Recovery Manager is the industry-leading solution for application availability and mobility across sites in vSphere-based private cloud environments. In this session, SRM technical marketing, together with engineering will deliver a technical deep-dive on the benefits and integration capabilities in using SRM and VMware vRealize Automation together. We will demonstrate how vRA natively utilizes SRM to allow customers to access Disaster Recovery protection services at time of workload provisioning.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8159 - Snapshots Suck: How VSAN and VVol fix all your operational nightmares
PresentationDetailsList.Description: While traditional VMFS snapshots can assist with backups, and provide quick checkpoints there are a lot of operations limits to their use. Operationally many organizations have limited the use of this technology to avoid performance problems. In addition to performance problems, snapshots can also cause capacity problems. John Nicholson and Pete Flecha will outline how new VMware snapshot offload systems in VSAN and VVOLs fix these problems. We will explain how these new technologies work and what use cases these technologies will allow.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9969-SPO - How Did Designer Shoe Warehouse Lace up Success With Flash-Optimized Storage From INFINIDAT?
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
You may think DSW (Designer Shoe Warehouse) is simply one of the world top destinations for name brand shoes at a great value. In reality, DSW is much more than that, with a rich ecosystem of client focused solutions and over $2.6B in sales, the growth at DSW is in part thanks to leveraging Information Technology as a competitive advantage. When the DSW team looked to modernize their environment they looked to reduce the risk, cost and complexity of their most important asset - their information. DSW 95% virtualized environment, needed to be scaled to support the requirements of their expanding client base and market. DSW selected INFINIDAT InfiniBoxTM flash-optimized storage platform based on their requirements for high levels of performance, reliability, and cost tightly integrated into their VMware environment ensuring simplicity at scale. The team at DSW learned many best practices through the process, including:

Cost-effectively deliver performance, reliability, and scalability needed today and into tomorrow.
Consolidate multiple legacy storage platforms to a single, easy to manage and maintain solution that seamlessly scales.
Reliably perform regardless of changes in the environment or failures in their system, including replicating their mission critical environment to a DR facility.
Provide certified integration with VMware through standard APIs - enabling IT administrators to cut down the number of manual, error-prone tasks needed to deliver resources to their clients and market.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7831 - Storage for Cloud Native Applications
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Enterprises today are embracing new frameworks for application development and deployment. These Cloud Native Applications are written to be deployed anywhere (on-prem and in the cloud). Containers and micro-services are two popular frameworks that are being used. In this session, we will focus on persistent storage requirements of these Cloud Native Applications and provide an overview of VMware technologies that deliver persistent storage capabilities. Join us to learn more about how to deploy mission critical and data heavy application using Docker, Kubernetes on vSphere.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9422 - Essential Virtual SAN Management
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtual SAN provides clustered storage for virtual machines in a vSphere hyper-converged infrastructure environment. One of the main value proposition of Virtual SAN is the ability to be managed simply and efficiently. In SDDC context, customers can manage VSAN operations using vCenter or leverage VMware vRealize Suite and its components such as vRealize Operations, vRealize Automation and LogInsight to gain simple and intelligent operations management of Virtual SAN. This session will cover fundamental VSAN management operations and how each of these management products within vRealize suite can be used to effectively manage Virtual SAN, performance services, logging and navigating through various dashboards. New Virtual SAN users or customers who are planning to use Virtual SAN will benefit from the deep dive of the session.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9449-SPO - Journey to the SDDC: The Who, What, Why and Oh No of Moving to a Modern Data Center Platform
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The data center of today is dependent on flexibility and efficiency - a drastic change from vendor-driven monolith solutions of the past. Find out how the data center has transitioned from the cost center of old to today's software-defined data center.   This session focuses on exploring the types of solutions that can enhance today systems, from all-flash to software-defined storage and networking. Hear from multiple customers and learn the pros and cons of making the transition as well as what to watch out for during your transition to the modern data center.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7965 - VMware Site Recovery Manager: Technical Walkthrough and Best Practices
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Site Recovery Manager is the industry-leading solution for application availability and mobility across sites in vSphere-based private cloud environments. In this session, SRM product management will deliver a technical walkthrough on Site Recovery Manager focusing on both advanced and basic functionality. The discussion will include many user interface screen shots and a product demo. We will also cover best practices for deploying and using Site Recovery Manager as part of a holistic availability strategy for virtualized environments.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7535 - Conducting a Successful Virtual SAN 6.2 Proof of Concept
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session will give the attendee all the the information to conduct a successful Virtual SAN Proof Of Concept (POC). It will show them how to correctly and properly setup a VSAN environment (hosts, storage, networking), verify that it is operating correctly and then process to show how to test the full functionality of VSAN. It will highlight how to verify the VM Storage Policies are working correctly, and integral part of Software Defined Storage and VSAN. It will show how VSAN handles failures, and how to test that it is handling these events correctly. The session will also look at some specific use-cases, such as remote office/branch office (ROBO) deployments and stretched cluster. It will also cover a the various tooling (both internal and external) that can be used during a POC, such as RVC, the Ruby vSphere Console, the VSAN.Observer web based analysis tool and also the VSAN Health Service plugin. New 6.2 features will also be discussed, with an emphasis on how they can be evaluated during a POC. After taking this session, attendees will be empowered to go and implement their own VSAN POCs

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9079 - Virtual SAN for VMware Service Providers
PresentationDetailsList.Description: As the cloud market heats up many VMware Service Providers are looking at new scale-out architectures that leverage industry standard hardware in order to drive cost and product differentiation for their customers. Ultimately a Software Defined Architecture is what many providers are striving for. Virtual SAN enables key cost saving and architectural benefits in such environments, so let explore some of those specific benefits and how VMware Service Providers are leveraging Virtual SAN today and what the future may hold. You’ll also hear from a well known US based service provider who adopted Virtual SAN and is using it at scale today.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO10801-SPO - Modernizing with Private and Hybrid Cloud: How CSC & VMware move enterprise clients to next-generation infrastructures
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Unleash the full potential of software defined technologies within your hybrid cloud environment. Learn how CSC and VMWare have used these technologies to successfully deliver next generation cloud solutions to our joint clients. Take full advantage of CSC services, expertise, and support along with the latest technologies from VMware, including VMware NSX and Virtual SAN, to crack the code of delivering superior business results for enterprise clients quickly, efficiently and profitably.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7904 - Virtual SAN Management Current & Future
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Virtual SAN and VMware Hyper-Converged Software (HCS) are designed for unparalleled simplicity, in both small and extremely large environments. While being easy to use, Virtual SAN offers comprehensive management functionality and automation, covering all aspects of deployment, lifecycle management, monitoring, troubleshooting and performance of the HCS solution. In this session we are going to present a status update, covering the many new features added to Virtual SAN in recent releases, as well as share a roadmap for where we plan to take the product. We will cover topics like Virtual SAN Health and Performance Service, Virtual SAN Management SDK, lifecycle management, scale-out management, auto config, and Virtual SAN analytics.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8165R - VSAN Networking Deep Dive and Best Practices
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The network is critical to a reliable and performant VSAN solution. In this session we will discuss best practices, solution requirements, and operational best practices. Recommendations around multicast, link aggregation, and network sizing will be included in this session. The implications of running NSX along side VSAN will also be discussed.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8694 - High-Speed Heroics: Array-based Replication and Recovery for VMware Virtual Volumes
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Virtual Volumes bring unprecedented flexibility to storage. Custom tailored storage policies can be created to fit the needs of individual applications rather than entire datastores. However, not all VVols implementations are the same and some use cases, such as replication and recovery, can become a major bottleneck limiting their usefulness. On the other hand, when paired with array-based replication capabilities, the benefits of VVols can be significantly enhanced utilizing native functionality for VM tuning, protection, replication, recovery and more.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8923 - PowerShelling Storage to the extreme
PresentationDetailsList.Description: With enterprise vendors providing rich PowerShell snap-ins to their products, just how far can we take these cmdlets? Combining VMware cmdlets with cmdlets for servers, storage, networking, and applications, can take the monotony out of day to day tasks, and ensure completion. But why stop there? We’ll take a look at more complex storage-based solutions that can be scripted into simplicity. Let your imagination be the limit!

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8179R - Understanding the Availability Features of Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Application uptime and resiliency to failure are key factors with any hyper-converged infrastructure (HCI) storage solution. Before choosing a platform, it is important to understand its ability to recover from issues such as disk, host, and even entire site failures. This session will focus specifically on the availability features of VMware Virtual SAN. It is a technical discussion that begins with a quick explanation of how Virtual SAN stores virtual machine objects such as configuration (VMX) files and virtual disk (VMDK) files. Next, we will take a look at storage policy-based management (SPBM) as this is the primary method for configuring and managing the levels of resiliency for virtual machine objects. We will examine the differences between and requirements for RAID-1 mirroring and RAID-5/6 erasure coding rules in Virtual SAN storage policies and how these rules affect the number and placement of objects. Next, we will provide technical details around Virtual SAN fault domains and stretched clusters. The session will finish with some notes on Virtual SAN data protection using VMware vSphere Replication and VMware vSphere Data Protection while leaving sufficient time for Q&A with the speakers.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7802 - Simplifying Disaster Recovery in 2016 using VSAN, NSX and SRM
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Datacenter disaster recovery has always been complex with too many moving parts from to many separate vendors. Storage replication, application continuity and networking are complex technologies to maintain across multiple datacenters. When your physical infrastructure lets you down, it time to turn to SDDC for the peace of mind and simplicity businesses are looking for today. Using the software defined datacenter approach vastly improves the RPO and RTO of your businesses disaster recovery requirements. In this session we will show you how using VMware VSAN technology for storage, replication and performance, NSX for network virtualization, and SRM for recovery automation and orchestration, disaster recovery in 2016 has never been easier to manage and maintain. This session will include a live demo showcasing these technologies in a real world environment.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8144 - VMware vSphere Virtual Volumes in a NetApp Environment
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtual Volumes (VVol) is a framework developed by VMware and partners in the storage industry to transform the way VMs are stored by enabling VM-awareness on arrays. VVols eliminate static storage constraints by removing LUNs, filesystems, and volumes, and giving the array direct visibility and understanding of the VM objects they store. This enables a flexible policy based approach to storing and managing VMs without traditional concerns about capability and capacity management bounded by LUNs on the physical infrastructure. In this session we will look at the VVol framework VMware has created, and how NetApp is using this to deliver a new generation of VM-aware storage that places the VMs in charge. SAN and NAS devices are pooled into storage containers that deliver every capability of the array (such as compression, encryption, QoS, and more) to each VM as an individual and discrete object, fully integrating with VMware Storage Policy Based Management interface. We will look at the policy based consumption model as well as the specific technical components of VVols that enable this functionality: Protocol Endpoints, VASA Providers, Storage Containers, virtual datastores, and more. Learn about this revolutionary change in the way storage is delivered to VMware environments, and how this industry-wide initiative will allow you an efficient and intelligent new way to use NetApp arrays.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8689 - Virtual SAN Primer and What?s New
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Have you heard the buzz around HCI and Virtual SAN but have not had the time to catch up completely? If so, this session is designed for you. We will cover all the basics of this hyper-converged technology, explain the key functionality and capabilities including the latest features. You will also get an overview of all the deployment options available on the market today as well as the business results you can expect from choosing Virtual SAN for your hyper-converged infrastructure environment.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7650 - Software-Defined Storage at VMware Primer
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session Lee and Duncan will give an overview of the different VMware Software Defined Storage initiatives and how these fit in to the broader SDDC picture. Theywill cover Virtual Volumes, Virtual SAN and the vSphere APIs for IO Filtering. For each of these 3 they will explain customer use cases and go over some of the basic concepts providing you with a good understanding of how to apply this to your environment.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8279 - Deploying Virtual SAN with VMware Private Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware internal private cloud is responsible for providing cloud infrastructure required by various groups within VMware to quickly deploy their workloads for production and development/test purposes. It is required to provide enterprise-class reliability, availability and the ability to scale to thousands of VMs. This private cloud utilizes the full SDDC stack that VMware actively promotes to its customers to use and deploy. Recently, Virtual SAN has been added as the software storage subsystem within the SDDC stack to provide infrastructure storage to the VMs/workloads within this cloud. This session will describe in detail the architecture of VMware private cloud and provide detailed description on the deployment of Virtual SAN within this cloud infrastructure. It will explain how Virtual SAN is able to help the storage scale to support thousands of VMs, which are instantiated and decommissioned every day. It will cover the operational challenges of maintaining this private cloud and the benefits provided by Virtual SAN in such an environment especially compared to traditional storage solutions. For customers planning to deploy Virtual SAN or SDDC stack in large-scale cloud deployments, this session will also help provide a reference to set up their own VMware SDDC-powered cloud.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7552r - Architecting High Availability and Workload Balancing for Tier 1 Mission Critical workloads using VMware Software Defined Storage and Extended Oracle RAC
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Running Extended Oracle RAC on VMware Virtual SAN Stretched Cluster delivers high availability, workload balancing, seamless site maintenace, stability, resilience , performance and cost effective hardware required to meet critical business SLA's for running mission critical workloads. VMware All Flash Virtual SAN enhances the performance of Oracle workloads tremendously. Features like Erasure Coding ,Checksum, Deduplication,Compression etc provides the much needed resiliency, protection and space efficiency for runing mission critical applications. VMware vRealize Operations Manager (vROPS) and Log-Insight can be seamlessly integrated to effectively manage and maintain Oracle workloads on VMware vsphere and Virtual SAN.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8840 - Deploy Scalable Private Cloud with vSphere Virtual Volumes
PresentationDetailsList.Description: A technical deep-dive on how using VMware Virtual Volumes (VVol) with Hitachi Storage systems will solve common challenges in managing VMs, streamline the storage operations with policy-based management and improve efficiency of VM operations. Hitachi introduced the VVol framework in its storage and converged platforms to enable organizations to fully realize the benefits of cloud-economics, user-control and automation. Hitachi storage policy-based management framework simplifies the VM provisioning, lifecycle management and data service delivery in private cloud deployments.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7557 - Successful Virtual SAN 6 Stretched Clusters
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Are you a VMware vSphere customer looking at using Virtual SAN in a stretched cluster configuration? Are you already familiar with stretched clusters using other storage technologies? This session will discuss how Virtual SAN can be used in stretched cluster scenarios. We will address some of the differences from other storage technologies, as well as some of the requirements and parameters when looking to implement Virtual SAN stretched clusters. You will leave the session with a better understanding of how Virtual SAN can easily and effectively fulfill the technical requirements of the stretched cluster use case, without many of the technical challenges associated with traditional storage. This session will include requirements, recommendations, failure scenarios, and more, promising to have something for new admins as well as seasoned infrastructure professionals.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7953 - The Future is Here:  Turbocharge All Flash Virtual SAN with Next Generation Hardware
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The future of storage is here. Flash is clearly gaining more and more prominence in enterprise storage. The evolution of high speed flash-based storage combined with high speed networks has had a significant impact on the Hyper Converged Infrastructure (HCI) market. In this session, we will discuss how we leverage newer hardware technologies to enable the fastest and most efficient hyper converged infrastructure solution with All Flash Virtual SAN. We will start with key design considerations for achieving the best performance with All Flash HCI. In doing so, we will go over real world customer use cases, key sizing guidelines and share performance metrics for high performance computing workloads driven by NVMe for Virtual SAN All Flash. We will then move on to analyzing benefits of adopting Non Volatile DIMMs and RDMA for Virtual SAN. Historically, the All Flash market was driven by “purpose-built” appliances with custom hardware to enable faster caching and reduce overall disk+network latencies. It wasnot considered feasible to do this in standard x86 servers connected on standard ethernet networks. Until recently, that is. Newer standards and technologies such as NVMe 1.2, Persistent DIMMs and RDMA over converged ethernet are expected to become standard in the OEM server market and will be driven by commoditization. We will go over benefits of adopting these high speed storage and network interconnects in the future for Virtual SAN. As cliched as this may sound, you are already part of this highly disruptive market. So what are you waiting for? Come and join us if you want to learn how VMware plans to lead market disruption with its turbocharged All Flash Virtual SAN offering by taking advantage of newer hardware technologies for HCI. The future is here: Are you?

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8179R - Understanding the Availability Features of Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Application uptime and resiliency to failure are key factors with any hyper-converged infrastructure (HCI) storage solution. Before choosing a platform, it is important to understand its ability to recover from issues such as disk, host, and even entire site failures. This session will focus specifically on the availability features of VMware Virtual SAN. It is a technical discussion that begins with a quick explanation of how Virtual SAN stores virtual machine objects such as configuration (VMX) files and virtual disk (VMDK) files. Next, we will take a look at storage policy-based management (SPBM) as this is the primary method for configuring and managing the levels of resiliency for virtual machine objects. We will examine the differences between and requirements for RAID-1 mirroring and RAID-5/6 erasure coding rules in Virtual SAN storage policies and how these rules affect the number and placement of objects. Next, we will provide technical details around Virtual SAN fault domains and stretched clusters. The session will finish with some notes on Virtual SAN data protection using VMware vSphere Replication and VMware vSphere Data Protection while leaving sufficient time for Q&A with the speakers.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9058 - Evolution of VMware Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Virtual SAN has revolutionized the way storage is consumed and managed in virtual environments. At the same time, the storage industry is going through a massive disruption with new hardware technologies, adoption of cloud, new models of storage consumption and new models of gaining insights from data. As we look at the data center of the future, Virtual SAN has the right architectural foundations to address the evolving needs of our customers. In this session, we present our view of how the IT infrastructure will be evolving to meet new customer needs. We outline the key architecture principles of VSAN and how they are being adapted to meet these new demands.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7534 - Virtual SAN - Day 2 Operations
PresentationDetailsList.Description: So you have deployed your new Virtual SAN and deployed your VMs. Now what? In this session, we will cover VSAN Day 2 Operations, and cover how to manage, monitor, troubleshoot and remediate common tasks and issues associated with hyper-converged infrastructure. You will be also introduced to a variety of tooling that can help with day 2 operations, including those that are built into VSAN, and those that can be added on. The session will be led by Cormac and Paudie, both of whom work in Customer[0] in the storage and availability business unit at VMware. These guys are the first customers for S&A products such as VSAN, and provide direct feedback to engineering on product usability and behaviour. They have a unique insight into how the products is used in customer environments, and will share with you various break/fix scenarios as well as demos on how to troubleshoot and fix issues that you may encounter in production.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9607-SPO - Running Business Critical Applications and the Software Defined Data Center on Hyper-Converged Infrastructure at the Speed of Flash
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtualization has advanced beyond the hypervisor to include software-defined storage, hyper-converged infrastructure software (such as Virtual SAN), and workload migration across data centers and cloud services. This panel session will discuss how to take full advantages of evolving SDS and HCIS capabilities with new flash-enabled architectures, including a number of reference configurations and architectures running the most demanding business applications, OLTP databases and VDI workloads. Panel speakers will provide their real-world insights on key decision criteria to include when considering a flash-enabled HCIS or SDS technology, including performance, density, manageability, and financial considerations. Extensive opportunities for audience Q&A will be included in this session as well.

Presenters.Name: Patric Chang, Western Digital Corp, Moderator
Presenters.LastName: Patric Chang, Western Digital Corp, Moderator

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7902 - VMware Virtual SAN: Enterprise-Grade Storage For Hyper-Converged Infrastructures
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session provides detailed insights into the technical facts and value proposition of Virtual SAN as a storage platform for hyper-covered infrastructures (HCI). It covers the scalable architecture and capabilities of the platform. It focuses on the new data services such deduplication, compression, erasure coding and QoS, which are aimed at today enterprise use cases. The session concludes with a technology roadmap that goes beyond traditional vSphere use cases. We make the case for HCI and Virtual SAN as a platform architecture for Cloud-Native Applications.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7875 - A Day in the Life of a VSAN I/O
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session Duncan and John will discuss what a typical day looks like in the life of an I/O (on a VSAN based solution). How does network based RAID-1 or RAID-5 work? Where does checksumming occur? When and how are blocks deduplicated or compressed? What about caching, are there different layers? Can I control where blocks are stored? And how does all of this influence availability and performance of my I/O?

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8904 - Hardware Choices in the Software Defined World – Tips on Choosing Hardware for Virtual SAN Deployment
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Have you looked at the HCL and wondered how best to pick the right hardware for your VSAN deployment. What things to consider and what traps to avoid.
In this session we will answer these questions while providing deeper technical insights behind those choices. We will discuss the engineering principles behind the design of the certification suite.
Finally we will wrap the session by sharing the challenges and approaches of enabling VSAN to run on rich diversity of our partner platforms.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9614-SPO - You have an all-flash Virtual SAN - what's next?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: We are experiencing the biggest technology transition since the beginning of commercial computing - the decline of traditional storage systems: SANs and magnetic hard drives. Direct-attached low latency and ultra-low latency non-volatile storage technologies facilitate massive increases in performance and scale. These technologies, when combined with VMware Virtual SAN and the power of vSphere profile driven storage, enable the transition from traditional applications, which require robust infrastructure services, to next generation applications with scaling and protection built in. Today, it clear to VMware and the IT industry that All-flash is the preferred configuration over hybrid Virtual SAN, but what next? Do you need to have the latest NVMe architecture, or will SATA or SAS suffice? What technologies come after flash SSDs, and how will that affect your storage? Micron has been on the forefront of pushing VMware Virtual SAN capabilities. Come see Rob Peglar as he will discuss the advantages of optimized All-flash Virtual SANs of today and give you a peek of the new storage technologies VMware Virtual SAN will be implementing in the future.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9054 - VVol and Storage Policy-Based Management ? Is It Everything They Said It Would Be?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Leading up to the release of vSphere 6 and vSphere Virtual Volumes (VVol) we heard from vendors, analysts, and bloggers alike how VVol and Storage Policy-Based Management (SPBM) were going to simplify storage operations, simplify delivery of storage service levels, and improve resource utilization and in general improve the lives of vSphere and storage administrators. Now that vSphere 6 and VVol is in out there and in use, have those dreams come true? In this session you will learn from Financial Advocates, a company that provides services to financial advisors, how they approached the use of VVol in their vSphere and Horizon View deployments – from understanding the impact it would have on their specific environment, rolling it out, assessing performance, using it with their flash storage array, applying Quality of Service (QoS) to VMs, and the overall advantages and benefits they see with VVol deploying with their storage array.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7755 - Storage for Virtual Environments - What's new and What's next for vSphere Storage
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The Storage market has been experiencing a tectonic shift as newer technologies (HCI, NVMe, Advanced Format Drives, All Flash storage systems, 3D xpoint Memory, High-performance fabric etc) are being rapidly introduced. Customers are faced with multiple choices when designing and architecting storage for virtual environments. This session will focus on the recent storage related enhancements in vSphere and will provide an overview of some of the key capabilities in the vSphere storage stack (VMFS, VVOLS, First Class Disks, Storage IO Control etc). This will be followed by a review of how these key capabilities align with the recent technological advancements in the storage industry. The session will conclude with a high level overview of some of the more recent developments in the storage market and VMware plans for the future.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8568 - Virtual SAN with just 2 Failure Domains
PresentationDetailsList.Description: How VMware and GSSC collaborated to create a solution for the US Navy that everyone said couldn't be done; create a Virtual SAN (VSAN) stretched cluster with just 2 failure domains. The failure domains were based on the 2 sources of power inside a ship, a hard constraint based on the ships' design. The previous (non-VMware) architecture included several limitations; most notably requiring manual administrative intervention to recover from outages and requiring a level of technical skill and understanding not present in the shipboard personnel performing these tasks. These limitations have resulted several times in having to provide onsite engineering support to perform recovery and troubleshooting, and have exposed a very real potential for permanent data loss due to lack of system understanding and inability to troubleshoot the complex environment by local resources, along with procedural issues. The other key challenges were to reduce the Space, Weight, and Power (SWaP) that the infrastructure consumes, as these resources come at a premium on a US Navy ship, and to significantly reduce system complexity for ease of administration. By eliminating the multiple legacy SANs previously required, these challenges were easily achievable and far exceeded expectations. VMware's Software Defined Datacenter (SDDC) capabilities brought together one fully supported solution which made IT resiliency easy, reduced downtime, reduced the amount of servers required, eliminated legacy SANs, and ultimately reduced the customer's total cost of ownership (TCO).

Presenters.Name: Michael Grossman, Government Secure Solutions CGI, Inc.
Presenters.LastName: Michael Grossman, Government Secure Solutions CGI, Inc.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8743 - Extreme Performance Series: Virtual SAN Performance Troubeshooting
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Troubleshooting performance issues in a distributed storage solution such as Virtual SAN is complicated due to the interconnectedness of storage, networking and compute. VMware Virtual SAN provides two tools to simplify troubleshooting: Virtual SAN Performance Service and VSAN Observer. In this presentation, we will go over both tools in detail: how to activate the tool, the types of data they collect and using examples, we will show how they can be used to diagnose performance issues. We will also talk about how to mitigate or solve common performance issues.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9967-SPO - Rethinking Data Protection:  The Rise of Hyperconverged Infrastructure and Built-in Backup and Disaster Recovery
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Data protection is a perennial problem for IT. Even with all of the data protection software and hardware solutions available, improving backup and disaster recovery is still a top priority for just about every IT team. What if there was a better way? What if you could back up a 1TB VM in 60 seconds or less, and recover in seconds? What if you could recover your entire data center from another location in minutes? And what if you could do all of this while eliminating the need for third-party backup solutions all together? Solving data protection requires a total rethinking of the traditional approach. Join this session to learn how hyperconverged infrastructure is leading the way. A live demo and customer testimonials will highlight SimpliVity capabilities, along with an open Q&A with SimpliVity head of product strategy. Attendees will learn more about: •How hyperconverged infrastructure addresses data protection modernization •How data protection in SimpliVity hyperconverged infrastructure compares with traditional backup and disaster recovery solutions •How SimpliVity global data deduplication introduces data efficiency that not only reduces capacity and bandwidth requirements for local and remote backups, but also significantly improves application performance

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9396-SPO - Real World Guidance for Implementing VMware Virtual SAN from Ready Nodes to Build Your Own
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Virtual SAN 6.2 adds new capabilities that dramatically change the value of hyper-converged infrastructure for broad scale deployment. If you are considering hyper converged infrastructure, come learn from Intel and VMware engineers on best design practices for Virtual SAN ranging from pre-configured and pre-certified Ready Nodes to certified components that can be leveraged to design your own system for varying workload requirements. This session will also cover guidance and best practices for customers who want to design their own Virtual SAN validated solution, including best known methods for performance tuning, optimizations, and measured cost/performance metrics with CapEx and OpEx considerations.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8165R - VSAN Networking Deep Dive and Best Practices
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The network is critical to a reliable and performant VSAN solution. In this session we will discuss best practices, solution requirements, and operational best practices. Recommendations around multicast, link aggregation, and network sizing will be included in this session. The implications of running NSX along side VSAN will also be discussed.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7977 - SRM with NSX: Simplifying Disaster Recovery Operations & Reducing RTO
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Site Recovery Manager is the industry-leading solution for application availability and mobility across sites in vSphere-based private cloud environments. In this session, SRM product management, together with engineering will deliver a technical deep-dive on the benefits and integration capabilities in using SRM and VMware NSX together.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7552 - Architecting High Availability and Workload Balancing for Tier 1 Mission Critical workloads using VMware Software Defined Storage and Extended Oracle RAC
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Running Extended Oracle RAC on VMware Virtual SAN Stretched Cluster delivers high availability, workload balancing, seamless site maintenace, stability, resilience , performance and cost effective hardware required to meet critical business SLA's for running mission critical workloads. VMware All Flash Virtual SAN enhances the performance of Oracle workloads tremendously. Features like Erasure Coding ,Checksum, Deduplication,Compression etc provides the much needed resiliency, protection and space efficiency for runing mission critical applications. VMware vRealize Operations Manager (vROPS) and Log-Insight can be seamlessly integrated to effectively manage and maintain Oracle workloads on VMware vsphere and Virtual SAN.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8488 - Hyperconvergence Panel Discussion: Exploring the ?Reality? of Hyper-Converged Infrastructure and Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This will be a panel discussion of Virtual SAN customers who have successfully deployed hyper-converged infrastructure in their environment for different workloads including virtual desktop infrastructure, tier-1 applications, remote offices, secondary datacenters etc. Learn about why these customers chose VMware hyper-converged software and infrastructure solutions, what factors they took into consideration while making the choice and how they architected their Virtual SAN environment. At the end of the session, you’ll have an overall understanding of how customers are using Virtual SAN, their varied use cases and what results they achieved to manage infrastructure costs and operational complexity.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7914 - Revamped vSphere Storage DRS and SIOC for automating the Data Centers
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Most modern Data Centers have a varied mix of storage (NFS, iSCSI, FC etc) with varying degree of feature capabilities (Auto-tiering, dedupe, Native snapshot etc.). As the Data Centers grow in size and complexity, the need for managing the storage efficiently has been paramount. vSphere marquee features StorageDRS and SIOC have been significantly revamped and simplified to ease the management of various storage types and workload through a Policy based approach. Come learn how storage policies, SIOC and SDRS can be leveraged to provide SLA guarantees to your tier-1 applications. Leave with some best practice guidelines for SDRS and SIOC while using these features along side with auto-tiered arrays, SRM, and svMotion

PresentationDetailsList.Name: HBC10704-QT - Backups to the cloud - Leverage the cloud for Business Continuity
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session you will gain an understanding of how you can leverage the cloud to provide you with an offsite backup and business continuity solution.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9988-QT - Running Epic with VSAN – Modern Architecture for Healthcare
PresentationDetailsList.Description: "Ryan Grim, Architect for Lancaster General Hospital, will discuss the benefits of VSAN for virtual machine storage with two years of experience. Learn about the financial savings, reliability improvements, performance improvements, scalability improvements, and quality of life improvements enabled by this platform transformation."

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9987-QT - Hardware Procurement Guide for Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: One of the most important prerequisite steps in deploying Virtual SAN successfully is acquiring the correct hardware. Virtual SAN has hardware options ranging from EVO/VxRail to ReadyNodes to build-your-own. We will go over how to choose hardware that will make your Virtual SAN environment rock solid and with high performance.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: HBC10703-QT - Top Tips for Moving to the Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Are you looking to move to the cloud? Wondering why I should use the cloud? What is the cloud all about? Come to this session to find out top tips for consuming the cloud

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9977-QT - 5 Tips for Getting The Most From Virtual Volumes and vSphere Storage Policy-Based Management
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Are you looking to make the most out of your storage investment by streamlining your operations? These brief tips will help you use Storage Policy-Based Management to deliver agility to your operations and streamline the interface between vSphere and your storage platform of choice. The tips will cover: - Automating deployments at scale. - Flexible approaches to workload placement. - Integrating Storage Policy-Based Management with third party solutions. - Effective organization of policies for reuse.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9991-QT - vSphere Web Client Plug-in Certification Program
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The behavior of Web Client Plug-ins is one of the most important aspects of vSphere administration. To help assure a consistent vCenter end-user experience,VMware recently launched the vSphere Web Client Plug-in Certification Program for partners.  VMware-ready Web Client Plug-ins are guaranteed to work without adverse impact to vCenter Server, and are supported by VMware GSS. Once certified, Plug-ins will be listed on VMware Compatible Guide and receive the VMware-ready logo. In this Quick Talk, we will provide an overview of the certification program for vSphere Web Client Plug-ins, as well as discuss partner traction and future direction for Web Client Plug-ins.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8267 - Hours to Minutes: Automated Provisioning and Deployment Using PowerCLI, vRealize Automation and vRealize Orchestrator
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware IT has a large project portfolio with over 60 remote sites that need to be provisioned with core footprint virtual machines (VMs). The deployment of these machines requires additional resources and expenses. VM lifecycle management and application configuration (creation to retirement) is time-consuming, error prone and involves manual efforts. The ability to automatically provision new infrastructure and reduce manual efforts is a vital building block to establishing an on-demand model for IT and to better serving the needs of the business by reducing costs and increasing efficiency. The VMware IT Tenant Operations team will discuss its solution using PowerCLI, vRealize Automation (vRA) and vRealize Orchestrator (vRO) that reduces critical provisioning time to configure the footprint VMs from hours to minutes on the EVO VxRail platform.
